title: 6.2 Lunch Break - tto123
description: Deze les valt onder de arrangeerbare leerlijn van de Stercollectie voor Engels voor tweetalig onderwijs, leerjaar 1, 2 en 3. Dit is thema 6 'School'. Het onderwerp van deze les is: My timetable. In deze les staat het lesrooster centraal. Daarnaast worden ook de pauzes en (gezonde) schoollunch gesproken. De grammaticaopdracht gaat over de 'past simple' en regelmatige werkwoorden.

items.content:
The subject of this period is timetables and breaks.

  • Form groups of three or four pupils.

Discuss the following questions in your group:

  • What does your timetable look like?
  • Discuss the subjects on your timetable. Which ones do you like or dislike? Explain why.
  • What do you do during the breaks?
Step Activity Aim Time
Introduction Find out what you already know. 10
Step 1 Reading
Jason's timetable 		You can understand a text about a timetable and answer questions. 15
Step 2 Listening
Healthy lunch		 You can understand a video about preparing school lunch and answer questions. 15
Step 3 Vocabulary You can understand and use vocabulary about timetables and breaks. 15
Step 4 Grammar
Past simple		 You can understand and use the past simple. 15
Step 5 Speaking
Speech card		 You can have a conversation talking about your timetable. 10
Step 6 Writing
An essay about your timetable		 You can write an essay about your timetable. 15
Step 7 Evaluation Reflect on what you have learned. 05
Step 8 Extra
School Lunch Break		 Watch the video.

Jason's timetable
You are going to read a text about Jason's timetable.

  • Read the text.
  • Do assignment 1.(First on your own, than compare your answers in your group).
  • Do assignment 2.

Jason's timetable

Jason goes to school from Monday to Friday. He has got ten different subjects at his school. Every day the first period is free. The lunch break is always after the fourth period.

On Monday Jason starts with History followed by Maths and Biology. After the lunch break he goes to Chemistry, Economics and he ends the day with Self-Defense.

On Tuesday the morning lessons are Languages, Art and Chemistry. In the afternoon Jason has Biology, Technology and like on Monday he ends the day with Self-Defense.

On Wedneday Jason's school day starts with Maths followed by Economics and Self-Defense.After the lunch break Jason has History and Languages. He ends the day with his favourite subject. P.E., that is short for Physical Education.

On Thursday morning his timetable starts with Biology, Chemistry and P.E. The three lessons that follow in the afternoon are: Technology, Maths and Art.

Friday is the last school day of the week. The morning lessons start with History, Art and P.E. After lunch break Languages and Technology. Jason ends his school week with Economics.

content.body:
You have read the text about Jason's timetable. Now you are going to fill in his timetable with the information from the text.

Monday

Wednesday

Are the following statements true or false?

Jason goes to school 6 days a week. True False
Jason has chemistry class three times a week. True False
On Wednesday, Jason's languages class is before lunch. True False
On Friday, Jason's economics class is before his technology class. True False
Jason's self defense class is the last class of the day on Mondays and Tuesdays. True False
Jason's art class is his first class on Thursdays. True False

items.content:
Healthy lunch ideas for school
You are going to watch a video made by Aspyn Ovard about school lunches.

  • Form groups of 3 or 4 pupils and do assignment 1.
  • Read the questions (assignment 2).
  • Do assignment 3.

Assignment 1

In groups of three or four pupils discuss what you have for lunch at school.

  • Do you bring your own lunch or do you buy your food in the school canteen?
  • So, what do you have for lunch at school?
  • What is the best lunch?
  • Make a list and compare your list with other groups' lists.

Assignment 2

Read the following questions.
What is on the menu on:

  • Monday?
  • Tuesday?
  • Wednesday?
  • Thursday?
  • Friday?

Assignment 3

Watch the video and answer the questions.

prompt.body: What is on the menu on Monday?

content.body: a peanut butter sandwich with jelly, an apple, cellery and carrots.
a peanut butter sandwich with spinach, lettuce and strawberries.
a peanut butter sandwich with an apple, raspberries and strawberries.

prompt.body: What is on the menu on Tuesday?

content.body: a salad of spinach and lettuce with strawberries and fat free raspberry vinaigrette.
a salad of black beans and greek yoghurt adding some raspberries to the top.
a salad of carrots and lettuce with tomatoes and olives and some cheese.

prompt.body: What is on the menu on Wednesday?

content.body: a wrap with turkey and low fat garden vegetables spread and grapes.
a wrap with low fat garden vegetables spread, strawberries and raspberries.
a wrap with low fat garden vegetables spread spinach, olives , cheese and carrots.

prompt.body: What is on the menu on Thursday?

content.body: a salad of spinach and lettuce with red and yellow peppers and lime juice.
a salad of black beans with corn, red and yellow peppers and lime juice.
a salad of carrots and lettuce with strawberries and fat free raspberry vinaigrette.

prompt.body: What is on the menu on Friday?

content.body: a pita with spinach, tomatoes, cheese, water melon and hard boiled eggs.
a pita with carrots, raspberries, water melon and hard boiled eggs.
a pita with lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, water melon and hard boiled eggs.

items.content:
To be able to do all the assignments correctly, you need to know some words and sentences.
For each theme there are word lists ready in Wozzol, with which you can practice:

Vocabularylist Lunch Break
  • Study the vocabulary. (10 minutes)
  • Do the assignment.

Tip!
There are many ways to study vocabulary. You can read the words aloud or copy them. The most important rule is never to spend more than 10 minutes studying words. Every minute you spend longer is a waste of time.

content.body:
Fill in the correct word.
Choose from:
Art - Geography - History - Home Economics - Languages - luchbox - lunch break -Maths - Monday - P.E. - peanut butter - period - timetable - tutor

  1. I still need to check my to know wich subject is next.
  2. Do you know wich we have English?
  3. We have French after the .
  4. It is said that girls are bad at ……
  5. …… and boys are bad at . Is this true?
  6. Today in we learnt about the Second World War.
  7. We played football during .
  8. I am going to learn how to prepare a salad in .
  9. Our teacher is very good at painting portraits.
  10. Didn't they teach you in where England is on the map?

items.content: Study the knowledge bank about 'past simple' (past tense) with regular verbs.
Past simple - Regular verbs

Click on the following links for extra examples.

  • Past simple
  • Simple past

Now make the following assignments.

content.body:
Read the following sentences.
Is the past simple used correctly or incorrectly?

We cycled to France last year. Correct Incorrect
Did they played a game? Correct Incorrect
Washed my father his car last Sunday? Correct Incorrect
He banged his head. Correct Incorrect
They didn't arrive on time. Correct Incorrect
She didn't brushed her teeth this morning. Correct Incorrect
He cheated on his test. Correct Incorrect
My father didn't accept the gift. Correct Incorrect
Did they apologised after the fight? Correct Incorrect
He lived in New York in 2009. Correct Incorrect
Seamus dropped his keys. Correct Incorrect
Did she worked hard? Correct Incorrect
He didn't walk to school yesterday? Correct Incorrect
Arrived they on time yesterday? Correct Incorrect

Fill in the correct form of the verb.
Use the past simple.

He (walk) to school yesterday.
she (work) hard?
My mother (worry) when Peter didn't come home last night.
Seamus (not drop) his keys.

Fill in the correct form of the verb.
Use the past simple.

This morning we (talk) about it.
He (live) in New York in 2009.
they (apologise) after their fight?
My father (not accept) the gift.

Fill in the correct form of the verb.
Use the past simple.

Our teacher (talk) about Robin Hood last week.
Robin Hood (live) in Sherwood Forrest long ago.
He (not like) King John, who was a bad king.
he (marry) Lady Marianne in the end?

Fill in the correct form of the verb.
Use the past simple.

I (receive) a letter last week.
My brother (wash) his car last month.
Debby (not play) here yesterday.
We (dance) until 4 in the morning.

items.content:
Speech card
Now you are going to have a conversation about school with a classmate. Imagine you and your partner went to the same primary school, but then went to different secondary schools.

  1. Find someone to work with and use the speech card.
  2. Write down a couple of words to help you during the conversation.
  3. If you need help, go to the 'Words' section in the toolbox.

After practising twice, do the following things:

  1. Find another pair to work with.
  2. Act out your conversation.
  3. Let them write down feedback for you.
  4. Let them act out their conversation and write down feedback for them.
  5. Discuss what things were good and what you can do better next time.

Person A

Person B

1

Greet person B.

1

Greet person A.

2

Ask his or her name.

2

Answer the question.
Also ask his or her name.

3

Answer the question.
Ask in which class he or she is in.

3

Answer the question.
Ask when he or she has a break.

4

Answer the question.
Ask if he or she can name three school subjects.

4

Answer the question.
Also ask if he or she can name three school subjects.

5

Answer the question.
Ask which school subject is their favourite.

5

Answer the question.
Also ask which school subject is their favourite.

6

Answer the question.
Ask when he or she has recess.

6

Answer the question.
Say that after the break you'll have physical education, and you're looking forward to it.

7

Wish him or her a nice day and end the conversation.

7

React and end the conversation.

An essay about your timetable
You have read an article about Jason's timetable. Now you are going to write about your own timetable.

  • Describe when you have which subjects.
  • Describe when your school day starts and ends.
  • Give information about the breaks. What do you do during breaks?
  • Mention which subjects you like or dislike and also explain why.

Ask your teacher how many words you have to use.

What have you learnt in this period?
Answer the following questions:

  • What was the easiest part of this lesson?
  • What did you already know?
  • What was the most difficult part?
  • What was new to you in this lesson?
  • Do you have any questions for your teacher?

School Lunch Breaks

You are going to watch a video from FilterCopy about School Lunch Breaks.

  • Watch the video.
  • Does the lunch break in the video looks like the lunch break at your school?
    Write down two differences.
